Instructions: Saute pasta, chicken, and garlic in a pan. Slowly stir in heavy cream and parmesan cheese. Simmer until sauce thickens. Serve with breadsticks. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can use half-and-half instead of heavy cream.

Instructions: Cook rice separately. Stir fry beef and garlic in a pan. Add broccoli and soy sauce. Cook until beef is cooked through and broccoli is tender. Serve over rice. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can add red pepper flakes for spice.

Instructions: Saute onions, garlic, and bell peppers in a pot. Add beans, tomatoes, corn, and spices. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with avocado and sour cream. Easy
Ingredient Source: Can add ground turkey for non-vegetarian option.

Instructions: Spiralize zucchinis into noodles. Saute shrimp, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a pan. Add white wine and butter. Cook until shrimp is pink. Toss with zucchini noodles. Serve with lemon wedges. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can use angel hair pasta instead of zucchini noodles.

Instructions: Cook rice separately. Saute chicken and garlic in a pan. Add butter chicken sauce and cook until chicken is cooked through. Serve with naan bread. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can add heavy cream for richer sauce.

Instructions: Whisk together balsamic vinegar and sugar in a saucepan. Simmer until reduced by half. Slice mozzarella and tomatoes. Layer with basil and drizzle with balsamic glaze. Serve immediately. Easy
Brush salmon with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and herbs. Slice lemons and place on top of salmon. Bake at 400Â°F for 12 minutes. Serve with steamed vegetables. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can add lemon slices to water for steaming vegetables.

Instructions: Cook rice separately. Saute pork and garlic in a wok. Add mixed vegetables and stir fry until tender. Add rice, soy sauce, and scrambled eggs. Cook until heated through. Serve with chopsticks. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can use shrimp instead of pork.

Instructions: Grill chicken until cooked through. Slice into strips. Toss mixed greens, cucumber, tomato, red onion, and feta cheese in a bowl. Serve with chicken on top and drizzle with Greek dressing. Easy
Mix tuna, soy sauce, sesame oil, and green onions in a bowl. Serve over sushi rice and top with sliced avocado, seaweed, and cucumber. Drizzle with sriracha mayo if desired. Medium
Ingredient Source: Can use fresh tuna instead of canned.</s>
